properties.areaDesc: Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; Western Mosquito Range/East Lake County Above 11000 Ft; South and Southeast Grand/West Central and Southwest Boulder/Gilpin/Clear Creek/Summit/North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains; Flat Tops; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Gore and Elk Mountains/Central Mountain Valleys; South and East Jackson/Larimer/North and Northeast Grand/Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet
properties.headline: Avalanche Warning issued February 7 at 1:46PM MST by NWS Denver CO
properties.description:
THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE
COLORADO AVALANCHE INFORMATION CENTER.

AVALANCHE WARNING BEEN EXTENDED FOR THE CAIC STEAMBOAT AND FLAT
TOPS...FRONT RANGE... VAIL-SUMMIT...ASPEN...GUNNISON... AND SAWATCH
ZONES

* TIMING...Beginning 5:00 AM Friday February 7. Expires at 8:00 AM
Sunday February 9.

* AFFECTED AREA...Park Range...Elk Head Mountains...Flat Top
Mountains...Medicine Bow Mountains...Williams Fork Mountains...Ten
Mile Range...Gore Mountains...Elk Mountains...Hardscrabble
Mountains...Red Table...Ruby Range...West Elk Mountains...Mosquito
Range...Sawatch Range

* AVALANCHE DANGER...The avalanche danger is HIGH (Level 4 of 5).
Avalanches large enough to bury and kill a person are likely
through Sunday morning. Many avalanches will run naturally. You
can trigger avalanches from the bottom of slopes or from a
distance. If you trigger an avalanche it will be large and very
dangerous.

* REASON... Intense snowfall and strong winds are creating very
dangerous avalanche conditions.
properties.instruction:
is not recommended.

Consult www.colorado.gov/avalanche for detailed information.

Lazar
